```{r, fig.width=40, fig.height=40, out.width="100%"}
library(ggplot2)
library(gridExtra)
library(png)  # For reading PNG images
library(grid)  # For rasterGrob

# Assuming all images are PNG files. If they are in another format, adjust accordingly.
# Read all images
img_original <- rasterGrob(readPNG("original_data.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_knn <- rasterGrob(readPNG("knn.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_multi <- rasterGrob(readPNG("multi.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_rf <- rasterGrob(readPNG("rf.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_svm <- rasterGrob(readPNG("svm.png"), interpolate=TRUE)

img_knn_x1 <- rasterGrob(readPNG("knn_x1.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_multi_x1 <- rasterGrob(readPNG("multi_x1.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_rf_x1 <- rasterGrob(readPNG("rf_x1.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_svm_x1 <- rasterGrob(readPNG("svm_x1.png"), interpolate=TRUE)

img_knn_x2 <- rasterGrob(readPNG("knn_x2.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_multi_x2 <- rasterGrob(readPNG("multi_x2.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_rf_x2 <- rasterGrob(readPNG("rf_x2.png"), interpolate=TRUE)
img_svm_x2 <- rasterGrob(readPNG("svm_x2.png"), interpolate=TRUE)

# Create a blank placeholder for empty cells (if needed)
blank <- grid.rect(gp=gpar(col="white"))

# Arrange the images in a 3x5 grid
grid_plot <- grid.arrange(
  # Row 1: Original data (none)
  img_original, img_knn, img_multi, img_rf, img_svm,
  
  # Row 2: Altered x1
   blank, img_knn_x1, img_multi_x1, img_rf_x1, img_svm_x1,
  
  # Row 3: Altered x2
   blank, img_knn_x2, img_multi_x2, img_rf_x2, img_svm_x2,
  
  nrow = 3,
  ncol = 5
)

# To save as a PDF or image, use ggsave() after creating the grid
# You may need to capture the grid.arrange output
# grid_plot <- arrangeGrob(...)
ggsave("layout.pdf", grid_plot, dpi=900)
```
